security: Revealing the identities and roles of agents like UNSNAFU/9, AMLASH/1, and AMTHIP/1, as well as operational methods (e.g., using a 'jeweler friend' as a cut-out), could compromise ongoing or future intelligence operations. The document explicitly discusses a plan to relay information through a secure channel using a coded conversation and a trusted intermediary, emphasizing the need for discretion and security. Quote: 'BELIEVE THIS SECURE ENOUGH AND EMINENTLY FASTER AND MORE CERTAIN THAN S/W LETTER.'
summary: This message discusses determining the background of UNSNAFU/19's statement about UNSNAFU/9 being a "dirty KUBARK agent" and proposes a method to relay this information to AMLASH/1 through AMTHIP/1 using a jeweler in Havana as a secure channel.
summary_one_paragraph: Dated March 24, 1965, this SECRET/RYBAT message outlines a plan to assess the validity of UNSNAFU/19's accusation that UNSNAFU/9 was a "dirty KUBARK agent." Concerned about potential hazards to AMLASH/1, the Director instructs the Paris station to task AMTHIP/1 with discreetly inquiring about the basis for UNSNAFU/19â€™s statement. The plan involves AMTHIP/1 contacting a jeweler friend, Jose Iglesias in Havana, under the guise of a business matter to relay pertinent details, ensuring the information reaches AMLASH/1 quickly and securely. The message stresses caution and requests notification if AMTHIP/1 deems the method unsafe.
title: Determining Background to UNSNAFU/19 Statement Regarding UNSNAFU/9
